basics.name: Erfan Abedi
basics.label: Computer Engineering Graduate
basics.summary: Erfan got his bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from Amirkabir University of Technology, he first started developing computer programs when he was twelve. He's currently a research assistant at Phanous Research and Innovation Centre, where he's working on Quantum Machine Learning.

projects.name: QSVT in Qiskit
projects.description: Implementing a quantum search algorithm based on Quantum Singular Value framework in Qiskit.
highlights: QSVT in Qiskit was selected as one of the top 3 winning projects of IBM's Qiskit Hackaton Europe 2021.
Quantum Singular Value Transformation (QSVT) is a framework that allows one to apply an arbitrary polynomial transformation to the singular values of a block-encoded unitary transformation.
In its current form, this project contains QSVT-implemented quantum search, utilizing Fixed-point Amplitude Amplification.

projects.name: Maqenta
projects.description: Maqenta is a software for generating music using Quantum Machine Learning
highlights: Maqenta uses methods such as Quantum Long Short-Term Memory and Quantum Generative Adversarial Networks for generating music.
Maqenta processes music in the form of MIDI files and after running the data through quantum machine learning methods, generates new music.
Maqenta served as Erfan's BSc project.
